cons: Eye Strain From Looking At Computer All Day

job_title: Asmissions Counselor in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: People that I worked with
cons: Management and executives were not good

review_title: It is hard to give this review
pros: Great staff and faculty. Students who were motivated to be in class to learn and engage with teachers.
cons: It was disappointing the way the corporate management team handled some administrative obstacles, which over the course of six months forced the closure of the school.

pros: It was a very friendly work environment
cons: I was hoping to work full time but at the time they were only offering part time hours.

job_title: Professor in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Provides educational opportunities to the few students who actually want an education
cons: Students are not there to study, but to get a visa to stay in America, and to hopefully find employment

job_title: Career Services Officer in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Rewarding and great, hard working colleagues
cons: No longer working due to closure

pros: It is a family environment
cons: On ground operations are closing

pros: 4 day work weeks were great!

review_title: Awesome school and awesome place to work
job_title: Help Desk Support Technician in North Ogden, UT
pros: Easy going atmosphere and great on the job learning
cons: No Cons at this institution.

job_title: Associate Dean of Business in Logan, UT
pros: The Logan campus was wonderful to work for.
cons: Sad the company had to close seven campuses during a pandemic.

pros: Great people to work with. Some drama here and there
cons: Lots of goals from upper management can get overwhelming

pros: My co-workers were the best ever. So much fun. Every day was hilarious. The pay was great. As long as you hit your goals you can do your job without being micromanaged. It was fun getting to meet new people every day outside your usual social circles. As long as you do your job and are well liked, you have great job security. It was genuinely my favorite job I've ever had.
cons:
Think about the show "The Office"- a lot of what you're asked to do is a total joke, and you do it anyway. But if you have a sense of humor, it can be fun along the way. They're gradually going downhill- their education is the worst and the lawsuits are going to eat them eventually. 

The top 3 people at this campus are laughable crazy. They have set up a 'good ol' boys club' for maximum job security, and are just totally out of touch with reality and nutso.  They are nitpicky about the weirdest things and you have to just play along sometimes to their odd whims. 

Goals are at times unrealistic, and you just have to go with it and do your best. Just shield yourself from the blasts you'll get from everyone and you'll be fine. Also everyone else at the campus hates your department but you're the cool kids so you don't care.

job_title: Lead Student Services Advisor in Idaho Falls, ID
pros: I love to help people.
cons: Not being able to help students.

review_title: Engaging and rewarding work, with great perks.
pros:
I have worked for Stevens-Henager College for over five years.  This school values people.  They value their employees, and their students.  I've seen so many people come through our doors looking to change their lives, and through education and the support of others, they do it!  What a rewarding place to work.  The programs are cutting edge, and are designed for what people want out of it: a good job. 

The compensation is on point, and so are the holiday and vacation benefits.
cons: I would like more training opportunities.  We do have trainings but most are offered though holding regular conference calls for a variety of topics (maybe with a PowerPoint tossed in ), but it's not the same as some hard-core training; especially with tough topics like VA education benefits, etc.  These calls just feel more like meetings.

job_title: Senior Financial Planner in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: I actually have worked for SHC/CEHE for over 5 years. I work for the online division - Independence University - and have loved every second of it. The company is great with recognition of employees doing well or employees who improve over time. Lower management is very uplifting and motivating when they see someone struggling. Team moral within the admissions department is amazing. Pay is fantastic, and ability to work from home is awesome. As a whole, the company does everything they can to boost moral and keep spirits up during busy/stressful times.
cons: Upper management sometimes uses scare tactics to motivate employees, and more often than not it doesn't work. It just deflates those of us who are lower level employees, and I'd say 8/10 times, the employee ends up either quitting or being let go because the tactic doesn't work and they don't get motivated to improve.

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in West Haven, UT
pros: Fair wages and plenty of parking
cons: This review is specifically about the West Haven, UT campus.  Dishonest. Poor benefits. Myself and fellow faculty were treated horribly.  One individual needed to go on FMLA but when she notified HR they illegally reported it to her supervisor who confronted her. Students know they can threaten with legal action to get grades changed even if they don't earn them.  Faculty are constantly pushed to pass students regardless of student effort.  This campus has no business having a nursing school.  Can't keep faculty due to maltreatment and are very willing to damage or threaten to damage faculty's reputation's to get what they want.  The administration acts as if the college is a high school popularity contest and the one who gossips the most with the President has the most power.  Student life is pathetic and expensive beyond compare.  The greater SLC community has a poor impression of graduates from S.H. and knows students can buy grades.  Nursing students beware!  This College will not likely be NLNAC nor NLN Accredited. Clinical experiences and hours do not meet requirements but the department lies to the accrediting bodies in order to get accredited

pros: This college accepts many students that would otherwise not be prepared  to attend college. The assistant Deans and Instructors go out of their way to help and encourage the students to succeed. They prepare students to get a job in today's market without the time involved in doing fluff courses ( GE). The comradery between employees is excellent and this is a wonderful work environment .
cons: Pay to adjunct instructors is not the best. To work here you must have a love of teaching and helping others succeed . It is hard to become a full-time faculty instructor since enrollment determines need.

review_title: Great place to work... if you have no ethical/moral compass
job_title: High School Admissions Representative in Ogden, UT
pros: I enjoyed my time at Stevens-Henager College for the fact that I LOVED what I was doing on a day to day basis as a recruiter working in the high schools. The admissions team was fun to be a part of and the compensation was great.
cons: There is absolutely no job security. The power struggle between department heads, campus presidents, and the CEO' was gross and redundant and negatively impacted the college as a whole, both employees and students. The college is based on an unethical backbone of greed.

pros: I have been with Stevens-Henager College for over 9 years. I feel like management truly cares about their employees' happiness and accomplishments. Hard work and positive results are always rewarded. I worked my way up from a very entry level position to a Director position. Even as an entry level employee, I always felt that my opinions were valued. It's been my experience that they nurture great employees to help them move up and achieve their goals. Everyone on campus does their best to make sure employees and students have a great experience.
cons: There could be more effective communication between campuses to share ideas.

review_title: My experience at Stevens-Henager was challenging at times, rewarding at times, and overall was a learning experience.
job_title: Financial Aid in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Promotions can be given freely to some. They allow employees to work from home when the need arises.
cons: There was not much room for growth as far as promotions go. And no one seems to be punished for bad behavior, in fact, at times it seems completely overlooked and even rewarded. There are favorites, and it is no fun to work there if you are not one of them. Also, there are ethical dilemmas I experienced quite often, due to the way students had been taken care of, and I was not willing to repeat the abuse.

review_title: Stevens-Henager College, or as it is now known, Independence University, does not treat employees well.
job_title: Admissions Consultant in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: I meet some great people working there. I was able to see a positive change in many of the students lives (I worked as an admissions consultant in the on-line division.)
cons: The company, however, is a boiler room. It is not, as they maintain, "all about the students" it is all about how many people you sign up for on-line college. they don't care, at the admissions management level, if the student will stay enrolled, or has the skills and abilities to succeed in college, only that they stay enrolled for at least 2 weeks.

review_title: It all depends on local management
pros: You get to work with a student population that really needs the training and skills offered at the college. You get to see people's lives change for the better. Campus employees form a close-knit community.
cons: You get to work with a student demographic that needs a lot more help with academics, interpersonal skills, and life management skills than traditional students. Each campus has a very different work environment from others, depending entirely on the campus leadership. Some are very positive and others bordering on abusive.

review_title: A Job to have to help students
pros: Fasted paced environment, fellow employees helpful and nice to work with. The work is challenging, and other employees are quick to help or teach you new tasks. You are given plenty of time to learn the skills needed to do well.
cons: Unprofessional work environment, and lots of inappropriate language used while trying to talk to students over the phone. Low student retention levels, and not special needs friendly. The work hours varied everyday, so it made it difficult to plan my family time. There was smoking at the entrance of the building, so if you don't smoke or are allergic that can be an irritation. I have a teaching background and I felt the training was non-existent. I saw a lot of turnover with the enrollment adviser positions.

job_title: Admissions Representative in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: The organization is based on high pressure sales approach. Employees are forced to sell a poor quality product for a premium price to individuals who would be far better serviced anywhere else. It is a total leach on government student aid, bilking millions and millions from the government and giving absolutely as little as possible back.
cons: This is the exact type of organization that is causing congressional alarms. If you have ever wondered what happened to all those who are not working sales in the used car industry, they are now in management at SHC. Constant monitoring of your every single move with a high-pressure used car sales approach. Every single call must be a sale - even if you have to lie, cheat and steal. This is the business model - Give Nothing and Expect Everything!

job_title: Faculty in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Plenty of case examples of my new book entitled "Any monkey can teach". If you have been dis-barred, or had a license revoked, this school will hire you and eventually promote you to Dean
cons:
Where to start. First and foremost, please do your homework before signing on to either attend school here or work here. Call employers and ask them what they think of Steven's Henager College graduates - be prepared to be laughed at. Also, make sure that you understand that this school changes names as frequently as possible to try and fool would be students and employers.  

It has been known as College America, Independence University, Stevens-Henager, California College of Health Sciences, and most recently as Carl Barney Millionaire Support Group.

review_title: Great. There a just some things that could use improvement.
job_title: Financial Planner in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: They are good at rewarding you. There are several award systems in place so you feel like you are being rewarded often. Co-workers are great. It's a nice welcoming group.
cons: Some managers are micromanagers. Depending on what team you're on, your job could be the most amazing jobs you've ever had or it could be one of the most frustrating. Even if you are doing really well you still have to have meetings with the managers on a weekly/biweekly basis.

review_title: Relaxed yet professional, great benefits and helpful management
job_title: Collections Specialist in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Full benefits after 90 days, recruiting is very pleasant and kinda and informative, streamlined hiring process, great atmosphere balancing relaxed yet a professional air. Nobody micromanages, you get answers to questions and get to be self-driven and self-motivated mostly.
cons: Dress code is a business which is rougher for a jeans-loving comfort-seeking girl like me, but it also makes you feel like you're going to work, and not just going shopping on a weekend. It's really quiet, so the social aspect isn't really there.

review_title: Positive environment woring with adult learners
pros: Teaching and sharing my experiences with adult learners who are motivated to learn a new skill and re-enter the workforce with a skill that is in demand in their industry.
cons: High tuition costs for students entering the workforce at an entry level position.  It will take them decades to pay off their debt at the rate they are being compensated for the education.

review_title: Love the people I work with, but I think the Corporation is dishonest
job_title: Financial Aid Officer in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Great starting salary.  I really enjoy the people that I work with.
cons: No room for promotions or growth with in the company.  I had only worked there for a year before I was told that I had maxed out my salary and my promotion opportunities.  That doesn't really motivate me to want to stay

job_title: Instructor in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Can't think of any. In an effort to be positive, one thing that is nice is that the paychecks don't bounce. How is that for positive?
cons: Wow - where to start. I have been working there for quite some time. Someone, somewhere is making a ton of money and it is not the employees. Each class costs the student around $2500. Multiply this by 30 for $75,000 per online course. They pay you $1100. This is half of what other institutions pay. If you want to micro-managed, underpaid, and make next to nothing, this is the place for you :)

pros: This used to be a place one would be happy to work - the students made it worth while.
cons: Leadership is narcissistic and vindictive in their leadership style.  Program offerings are shrinking every quarter. The school has been part of multiple law suits some of which have not been resolves.  As an employee - it is not uncommon for others to bully their peers unprofessionally. If you upset the wrong person, your days will be numbered. This is not a place any real professional would want to work.

job_title: Admissions Representative in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: The Pay. The Office is pretty.
cons: Be aware that often as not, SHC and Independence University Management enter fake reviews into several sites to try to make the company look better.  I'm not sure the ethics of anyone who would work for a school constantly under scrutiny by the Department of Education and who lied to students saying they were Non Profit when only their San Diego school was. Quality of education is poor and I still feel grieved that my name is professional tied to this school on my resume given the known issues this school has in the industry.

pros: The upper management truly values employees and works to promote from within. Input from everyone on the team is always encouraged and considered. There is a great atmosphere of teamwork. Great work like balance. I feel valued every day I'm at work. The Chairman of the Board is such an inspiring person and great values.
cons: Unfortunately, there are negative opinions about the college.

pros: Co-workers are great to be around. They try to work around a busy family schedule.
cons: Very low wage structure!!! Upper management more worried about  bottom line than how they treat their employees. It's all about the money to the company.

job_title: Online Admissions Representative in Murray, UT
pros: The Pay is good, but that's about it.
cons: *Rolls Eye* Oh Please "Department of Education is out to get small colleges."  There's a reason.  I felt like I lost my soul working for Stevens Henager.  It's about money first and foremost, don't be fooled otherwise.  They are one of the highest priced for profit colleges.  They have people take out student loans, and then have them take out private loans through the school.  In the end someone likely is going to have a monthly payment to the Fed for $300 and then at least $500 they pay the college for it's in house loan as well.  I've seen admissions reps lie to students to get them to enroll, I've seen them login and do peoples homework in the online classes so they would "count" for their start rates, etc.  Stevens Henager just got sued by the Fed because they were stating they were non-profit (The sister college California College of San Diego was and so they tried to state all the college under the College America Brands were). As a job it's a hard sell.... Very expensive, only regional accredited, and they quality of education is less that the competitors. Low Graduation ate (which the college prefers... they make more money if someone is enrolled a year, since they then the student owes the full tuition, but the college doesn't have to pay the teachers, etc.). I worked there two years and by the time I left I was so depressed and felt like I had really taking advantage of people, and help to sell them on something that had so little value. I knew managers who would not even hire Stevens Henager Graduates.  The money is good... but yeah... I don't know how anyone can work there, know their policies, and be able to feel ethical about what they are doing.

review_title: Marketing efforts focused on the online campus
pros:
The people are the best.
Excellent facilities.
Great parties.
cons:
Corporate management took over marketing efforts, and then funneled all of the leads to the online campus.  This caused the on-ground campuses to lose enrollments.
Advertising is somewhat old-fashioned, and not up-to-date.

review_title: This company is ripping off low-income people and paying their employees a shitload to do it
pros: Some of the employees are really cool and fun people to be around
cons: you have to sell this sham of a college to people who know next to nothing about any colleges and convince them to enroll. The price for the college is out the roof and the instruction throughout the program is a 3 out of 10 AT BEST. one of the teachers was a graduate of MUSIC teaching math.

job_title: Associate Dean in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Deans and their support staff care about the students and their future
cons:
Managers play a lot of politics 
They spent most of their meeting times slamming upper management and the decisions made, often by name.  They gave no raises, no yearly reviews.  Training was terrible if they ever trained people.  Upper management has no real idea how academics work, and they don't care.  They promote people who are definitely not qualified

job_title: Admissions Representative in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Great starting pay for new admissions people, fairly flexible schedule, free tuition after 1 year
cons: No pay raises, inconsistent management, faculty needs some work

review_title: I love studying at this college and they have the best caring professors around.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: I am not sure about working there as I live miles away but the people that I do know that work there are wonderful.
cons: Some professors seem to really don't care and rush us through our 4 week Module.

pros: Cant think of any, how we can sway are talking skills to take advantage of a uneducated individual. Really low tactics and angry if you cant sucker people with a GED to spend 70K. for
cons: The cons, where do I begin, I would say about 90 percent of the staff are fired or quit within one year of employment, a total joke. Save your time don't apply for this place....

pros: Great group of professionals who's goal is to encourage, educate, and mentor individuals to become as knowledgeable and proficient in their endeavors.
cons: Compensation could use a little work.

review_title: Disgusting company who lures you in without telling you the truth about the business.
job_title: Admissions Consultant in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Good pay. Some of the people that work there are cool.
cons: The benefits are terrible, cheap health care, good chance you will get fired when you come back from using vacation days.

review_title: Disappointing when there is so much potential for improvement.
pros: Nice people to work with.  Decent salary.
cons: Tools to succeed rarely provided.  No set training. Reflected in inconsistencies in policy and procedure from employee to employee.

review_title: Movement within the company is very hush, hush; most positions are filled prior to knowing they are available.
pros: It's rewarding to see how educations changes a persons life.
cons: At the end of the day there is still the pressure of any sales job.

pros: Good support for students. HR is very good at resolving issues
cons: Salaried employees are required to work too many hours from morning until late in the evening.

review_title: SHC is growing very fast and was trying to keep up with growing pains.
job_title: Tutor in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: flexible, rewarding work, educational, Telecommute
cons: pay scale, no reviews, mostly part-time with very few full time positions.

job_title: Customer Service in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: There are no pros to working for this company. They are a total for profit non college their credits don't transfer and they leave the students in the dark about it.
cons: Conartist, if you are willing to work for a company without any integrity then this would work for you. They allow students to get themselves into debt without a second thought.

review_title: Horrible diploma mill, uses deceptive trade practices to dupe students in to enrollment
job_title: Instructor in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Easy job, just sell your soul to dishonesty and you have a job for life
cons: To many to list.  This is a place you do not want to add to your resume.

job_title: Financial Planner in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Good pay, great people to work with
cons: Management and corporate are not up with the times and wont change the way the business is run to work better with the current social trends

job_title: Admissions Consultant in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Great co-workers, lots to do, stay busy never bored
cons: All responsibility is in the hands of admissions. Poor management, 90 days and you are out if you don't hit your numbers.

review_title: Lethargic, and depressing at times with short bursts of happiness.
pros: Good people to work with.
cons: Low pay, low energy from students.

pros: The hours were flexible and the schedule was friendly to those who have families. The lower management was also willing to work with individuals.
cons: Overall, management was poor and there was a lack of structure and communication between all department heads and instructors. There was an unfair pay structure, and I went over two years without any raise.

pros: They want you to be successful and will help you get there
cons: Too many online classes are all I can think about

job_title: Admissions Consultant in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Great Management, I was impressed by how they showed appreciation for their employees.
cons: Pay was average, but not unreasonable.

review_title: I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy.
pros: The only pro for me was that it was 2 minutes from my house.
cons: Very poorly managed. President at the Orem campus is out of touch with what the employees need to do their jobs efficiently.

pros: Decent Pay, good school for students
cons: Ogden Site Management very poor

pros: Satisfying helping students and helping them out.
cons: No real career growth or possibility for raises.

pros: Love the people  and the students
cons: You will never get a raise.

job_title: Admissions Consultant in Idaho Falls, ID
pros: Helping students achieve their dreams
cons: Not much at all to say about any cons

pros: work with schooling schedule, good pay
cons: sometimes other employees are demanding even during classtime

pros: Accelerated schedule. Small class sizes. Involved management.
cons: Student work ethic. Micro management.

pros: Allows students who cannot get into other schools to enroll
